column4: help!  My SD card isn't working in ubuntu, but it works fine in my friend's mac.. what can I do?
you'll need to simultaneously change the fstab and the bootloader entries.
Is it a single SD card which isn't working in Ubuntu, or does no SD card work (i.e. it's more likely a problem with the card reader)?
It's just this card.. my other cards work fine.
Does it use APM (Apple Partition Map)?
It's typical camera card.. FAT I believe
Possibly exfat?
What filesystem does OSX see it as? (Disk Utility should show you this).
I pulled up disk tool to check.. it's FAT16
OK. What type of partition table?
master boot record
OK. Can you insert the SD card and pastebin the output of "sudo parted -l"?
http://pastebin.com/QtrufYnP
Odd, parted doesn't detect any filesystem at all.
The files and folders come up in nautilus, but they're 0 bytes
A guide I found online suggested running dosfsck, which says "Logical sector size is zero."
Can you run "sudo umount /dev/mmcblk0p1 && sudo mount /dev/mmcblk0p1 /mnt/" and pastebin the output?
No output
Before you do anything else, if there are files on this SD card which you do not have backups for umount it, move it back to your mac, and back them up.
I think I agree.. it's just weird that it works fine in other computers but not ubuntu :[
After you've backed up your files see if dosfsck offers to fix the problem.
